pages.text: In addition to having multiple $(l:functions)functions$(), Glimmers come in different sizes: Stars, (regular) Glimmers and Large Glimmers.$(br2)Each of these are created from normal Glimmers, either by breaking them down or combining them together.

The default Glimmer, as created through a $(l:creation/rituals)ritual$(), in $(l:functions/receivers)receiver$() or $(l:functions/transmitters)transmitter$() mode, will access blocks in a 3x3 cube around it, where it is the center.

A Large Glimmer is created by combining 4 regular Glimmers. It will access blocks in a 5x5 cube around itself, where it is the center.$(br2)$(warning) Large Glimmers can only act as receivers or transmitters, not as relays.
Glimmers can be combined into a Large Glimmer, and the latter crafted shapelessly to obtain 4 regular Glimmers.

A Star Glimmer is obtained by shapelessly crafting with a regular Glimmer. It will access blocks in the 6 cardinal directions (plus up and down) around itself.$(br2)$(warning) As with the Large Glimmer, Star Glimmers can only act as receivers or transmitters -- not as relays.
